title: Christian Fuchs reveals the reason Leicester sacked Claudio Ranieri… because the players were showboating
text:
Comments CHRISTIAN Fuchs has accused his Leicester team-mates of costing Claudio Ranieri his job through non-stop showboating. 
The reigning Premier League champions sacked boss Ranieri last month after a disastrous run of results saw them drop into the relegation zone. Getty Images Christian Fuchs claims Leicester City stars have been too busy showboating this season 
And left-back Fuchs, 30, insisted the Foxes’ form suffered after they adopted an over-elaborate style of play. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Leicester City news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The Austria international said: “We were maybe over-motivated, and we wanted to prove just why we are the reigning champions.“There were spells when we played with fancy flourishes, back-heels and special finishes, simply to show what we can do.” PA:Press Association Christin Fuchs celebrates Premier League title success with former boss Claudio Ranieri last season Getty Images The Foxes have gone back to basics under interim boss Craig Shakespeare Getty Images Christian Fuchs and Danny Simpson are looking forward to a Champions League quarter final against Atletico Madrid West Ham 2-3 Leicester : Craig Shakespeare grabs first away win "We were no longer pragmatic, and we unintentionally neglected to do the basics. "There were no conversations between the club's bosses and the players about getting rid of Claudio Ranieri. "But I was sure that people would think we were to blame. Everyone was against us. "So we said to ourselves, 'Let's show 'em'. We went out and made a real statement with the way we played against Liverpool."
